text.p: Suppose [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^5 \rightarrow \mathbb R^4[/mathjaxinline] is a linear transformation with standard matrix [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline]. I am not going to tell you what [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is, but I will tell you that when you row-reduce [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline], the result is the matrix

Answer the following questions about [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] and/or [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline]. If there is not enough information to tell (e.g., because you only know [mathjaxinline]R[/mathjaxinline], not [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline]), select "Not enough information."
Are the columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] linearly dependent?
Does the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = \mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline] have a unique solution?
